member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.zoomFactor(System.Double)
member.summary: The default zoom factor of the page, 3.0 represents 300%. Default is 1.0.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.webgl(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables WebGL support. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.webSecurity(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When false, it will disable the same-origin policy (usually using testing websites by people), and set allowRunningInsecureContent to true if this options has not been set by user. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.textAreasAreResizable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Make TextArea elements resizable. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.spellcheck(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to enable the builtin spellchecker. Default is `false`.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.session(Electron.Session)
member.summary: Sets the session used by the page. Instead of passing the Session object directly, you can also choose to use the `partition` option instead, which accepts a partition string. When both session and partition are provided, session will be preferred. Default is the default session.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.scrollBounce(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables scroll bounce (rubber banding) effect on macOS. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.sandbox(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If set, this will sandbox the renderer associated with the window, making it compatible with the Chromium OS-level sandbox and disabling the Node.js engine. This is not the same as the `nodeIntegration` option and the APIs available to the preload script are more limited. Read more about the option here: https://electronjs.org/docs/api/sandbox-option.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.safeDialogsMessage(System.String)
member.summary: The message to display when consecutive dialog protection is triggered. If not defined the default message would be used, note that currently the default message is in English and not localized.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.safeDialogs(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to enable browser style consecutive dialog protection. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.preload(System.String)
member.summary: Specifies a script that will be loaded before other scripts run in the page. This script will always have access to node APIs no matter whether node integration is turned on or off. The value should be the absolute file path to the script. When node integration is turned off, the preload script can reintroduce Node global symbols back to the global scope.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.plugins(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether plugins should be enabled. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.partition(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the session used by the page according to the session's partition string. If partition starts with `persist:`, the page will use a persistent session available to all pages in the app with the same partition. If there is no persist: prefix, the page will use an in-memory session. By assigning the same partition, multiple pages can share the same session. Default is the default session.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.offscreen(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to enable offscreen rendering for the browser window. Defaults to false. See here for more details: https://electronjs.org/docs/tutorial/offscreen-rendering

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.nodeIntegrationInWorker(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether node integration is enabled in web workers. Default is false. More about this can be found here: https://electronjs.org/docs/tutorial/multithreading

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.nodeIntegrationInSubFrames(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Experimental option for enabling Node.js support in sub-frames such as iframes and child windows. All your preloads will load for every iframe, you can use process.isMainFrame to determine if you are in the main frame or not.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.nodeIntegration(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether node integration is enabled. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.navigateOnDragDrop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether dragging and dropping a file or link onto the page causes a navigation. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.nativeWindowOpen(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to use native window.open(). Defaults to false. Child windows will always have node integration disabled unless `nodeIntegrationInSubFrames` is `true`. Note: This option is currently experimental.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.minimumFontSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.javascript(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables JavaScript support. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.images(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables image support. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.experimentalFeatures(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables Chromium's experimental features. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.enableWebSQL(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to enable the [WebSQL api](https://www.w3.org/TR/webdatabase/). Default is `true`.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.enableRemoteModule(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to enable the `remote` module. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.enableBlinkFeatures(System.String)
member.summary: A list of feature strings to enable separated by comma, like CSSVariables,KeyboardEventKey. The full list of supported feature strings can be found here: https://cs.chromium.org/chromium/src/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/runtime_enabled_features.json5?l=70

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.disableHtmlFullscreenWindowResize(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to prevent the window from resizing when entering HTML Fullscreen. Default is `false`.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.disableDialogs(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to disable dialogs completely. Overrides `safeDialogs`. Default is `false`.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.disableBlinkFeatures(System.String)
member.summary: A list of feature strings to disable separated by comma, like CSSVariables,KeyboardEventKey. The full list of supported feature strings can be found here: https://cs.chromium.org/chromium/src/third_party/blink/renderer/platform/runtime_enabled_features.json5?l=70

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.devTools(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to enable DevTools. If it is set to false, can not use BrowserWindow.webContents.openDevTools() to open DevTools. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.defaultMonospaceFontSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Defaults to 13.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.defaultFontSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Defaults to 16.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.defaultFontFamily(Electron.DefaultFontFamily)
member.summary: Sets the default font for the font-family.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.defaultEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Defaults to ISO-8859-1.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.contextIsolation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to run Electron APIs and the specified preload script in a separate JavaScript context. Defaults to false. The context that the preload script runs in will still have full access to the document and window globals but it will use its own set of JavaScript builtins (Array, Object, JSON, etc.) and will be isolated from any changes made to the global environment by the loaded page. The Electron API will only be available in the preload script and not the loaded page. This option should be used when loading potentially untrusted remote content to ensure the loaded content cannot tamper with the preload script and any Electron APIs being used. This option uses the same technique used by Chrome Content Scripts. You can access this context in the dev tools by selecting the 'Electron Isolated Context' entry in the combo box at the top of the Console tab.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.backgroundThrottling(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to throttle animations and timers when the page becomes background. This also affects the Page Visibility API. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.autoplayPolicy(Electron.AutoplayPolicy)
member.summary: Autoplay policy to apply to content in the window.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.allowRunningInsecureContent(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allow an https page to run JavaScript, CSS or plugins from http URLs. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.affinity(System.String)
member.summary: When specified, web pages with the same affinity will run in the same renderer process. Note that due to reusing the renderer process, certain webPreferences options will also be shared between the web pages even when you specified different values for them, including but not limited to preload, sandbox and nodeIntegration. So it is suggested to use exact same webPreferences for web pages with the same affinity.

member.name: P:Electron.WebPreferences.additionalArguments(System.String[])
member.summary: A list of strings that will be appended to process.argv in the renderer process of this app. Useful for passing small bits of data down to renderer process preload scripts.

member.name: P:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlOptions.segments
member.summary: An array of segments to place in this control.

member.name: P:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlOptions.segmentStyle
member.summary: Style of the segments. Default is TouchBarSegmentedControlSegmentStyle.Automatic.

member.name: P:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlOptions.mode
member.summary: The selection mode of the control. Default is TouchBarSegmentedControlMode.Single.

member.name: P:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlOptions.change
member.summary: Called when the user selects a new segment. Called with the index of the segment the user selected, and whether as a result of user selection the segment is selected or not.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlMode.Buttons
member.summary: Make the segments act as buttons, each segment can be pressed and released but never marked as active. Maps to `NSSegmentSwitchTrackingMomentary`.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlMode.Multiple
member.summary: Multiple items can be selected at a time. Maps to `NSSegmentSwitchTrackingSelectAny`.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlMode.Single
member.summary: One item selected at a time, selecting one deselects the previously selected item. Maps to `NSSegmentSwitchTrackingSelectOne`.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlSegmentStyle.Separated
member.summary: The segments in the control are displayed very close to each other but not touching. Maps to `NSSegmentStyleSeparated`.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlSegmentStyle.SmallSquare
member.summary: The control is displayed using the small square style. Maps to `NSSegmentStyleSmallSquare`.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlSegmentStyle.Capsule
member.summary: The control is displayed using the capsule style. Maps to `NSSegmentStyleCapsule`.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlSegmentStyle.TexturedSquare
member.summary: The control is displayed using the textured square style. Maps to `NSSegmentStyleTexturedSquare`.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlSegmentStyle.RoundRect
member.summary: The control is displayed using the round rect style. Maps to `NSSegmentStyleRoundRect`.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlSegmentStyle.TexturedRounded
member.summary: The control is displayed using the textured rounded style. Maps to `NSSegmentStyleTexturedRounded`.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlSegmentStyle.Rounded
member.summary: The control is displayed using the rounded style. Maps to `NSSegmentStyleRounded`.

member.name: T:Electron.TouchBarSegmentedControlSegmentStyle.Automatic
member.summary: The appearance of the segmented control is automatically determined based on the type of window in which the control is displayed and the position within the window. Maps to `NSSegmentStyleAutomatic`.

member.summary: True to open the app at login, false to remove the app as a login item. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Electron.SetLoginItemSettings.openAsHidden(System.Boolean)
member.summary: [macOS] True to open the app as hidden. Defaults to false. The user can edit this setting from the System Preferences, so app.getLoginItemSettings().wasOpenedAsHidden should be checked when the app is opened to know the current value. This setting is not available on Mac App Store builds.

member.name: P:Electron.SetLoginItemSettings.args(System.String[])
member.summary: [Windows] The command-line arguments to pass to the executable. Defaults to an empty array. Take care to wrap paths in quotes.

member.name: P:Electron.ResizeOptions.quality(Electron.ResizeQuality)
member.summary: The desired quality of the resize image. These values express a desired quality/speed tradeoff. They are translated into an algorithm-specific method that depends on the capabilities (CPU, GPU) of the underlying platform. It is possible for all three methods to be mapped to the same algorithm on a given platform.

member.name: P:Electron.ProcessMemoryInfo.shared
member.summary: The amount of memory shared between processes, typically memory consumed by the Electron code itself in Kilobytes.

member.name: P:Electron.ProcessMemoryInfo.residentSet
member.summary:
[Linux, Windows] The amount of memory currently pinned to actual physical RAM in Kilobytes.
Chromium does not provide `residentSet` value for macOS. This is because macOS performs in-memory compression of pages that haven't been recently used. As a result the resident set size value is not what one would expect. `private` memory is more representative of the actual pre-compression memory usage of the process on macOS.

member.name: P:Electron.ProcessMemoryInfo.private
member.summary: The amount of memory not shared by other processes, such as JS heap or HTML content in Kilobytes.

member.summary: Size of all marked objects in Kilobytes.

member.summary: Size of all allocated objects in Kilobytes.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.title(System.String)
member.summary: Title of the message box, some platforms will not show it.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.normalizeAccessKeys(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Normalize the keyboard access keys across platforms. Default is false. Enabling this assumes & is used in the button labels for the placement of the keyboard shortcut access key and labels will be converted so they work correctly on each platform, & characters are removed on macOS, converted to _ on Linux, and left untouched on Windows. For example, a button label of Vie&w will be converted to Vie_w on Linux and View on macOS and can be selected via Alt-W on Windows and Linux.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.noLink(System.Boolean)
member.summary: On Windows Electron will try to figure out which one of the buttons are common buttons (like "Cancel" or "Yes"), and show the others as command links in the dialog. This can make the dialog appear in the style of modern Windows apps. If you don't like this behavior, you can set noLink to true.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.message(System.String)
member.summary: Content of the message box.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.detail(System.String)
member.summary: Extra information of the message.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.defaultId(System.Int32)
member.summary: Index of the button in the buttons array which will be selected by default when the message box opens.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.checkboxLabel(System.String)
member.summary: If provided, the message box will include a checkbox with the given label.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.checkboxChecked(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initial checked state of the checkbox. `false` by default.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.cancelId(System.Int32)
member.summary: The index of the button to be used to cancel the dialog, via the Esc key. By default this is assigned to the first button with "cancel" or "no" as the label. If no such labeled buttons exist and this option is not set, 0 will be used as the return value or callback response.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.buttons(System.String[])
member.summary: Array of texts for buttons. On Windows, an empty array will result in one button labeled "OK".

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.title
member.summary: Title of the message box, some platforms will not show it.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.normalizeAccessKeys
member.summary: Normalize the keyboard access keys across platforms. Default is false. Enabling this assumes & is used in the button labels for the placement of the keyboard shortcut access key and labels will be converted so they work correctly on each platform, & characters are removed on macOS, converted to _ on Linux, and left untouched on Windows. For example, a button label of Vie&w will be converted to Vie_w on Linux and View on macOS and can be selected via Alt-W on Windows and Linux.

member.name: P:Electron.MessageBoxOptions.noLink
member.summary: On Windows Electron will try to figure out which one of the buttons are common buttons (like "Cancel" or "Yes"), and show the others as command links in the dialog. This can make the dialog appear in the style of modern Windows apps. If you don't like this behavior, you can set noLink to true.

member.summary: The action of the menu item, when specified the `click` property will be ignored. More information: https://electronjs.org/docs/api/menu-item#roles

member.name: P:Electron.MenuItemOptions.registerAccelerator(System.Boolean)
member.summary: [Linux, Windows] If false, the accelerator won't be registered with the system, but it will still be displayed. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Electron.MenuItemOptions.id(System.String)
member.summary: Unique within a single menu. If defined then it can be used as a reference to this item by the position attribute.

member.summary: If false, the menu item will be greyed out and unclickable.

member.summary: Will be called when the menu item is clicked.

member.summary: Should only be specified for MenuItemType.Checkbox and MenuItemType.Radio type menu items.

member.name: P:Electron.MenuItemOptions.beforeGroupContaining(System.String[])
member.summary: Provides a means for a single context menu to declare the placement of their containing group before the containing group of the item with the specified label.

member.name: P:Electron.MenuItemOptions.before(System.String[])
member.summary: Inserts this item before the item with the specified label. If the referenced item doesn't exist the item will be inserted at the end of the menu. Also implies that the menu item in question should be placed in the same group as the item.

member.name: P:Electron.MenuItemOptions.afterGroupContaining(System.String[])
member.summary: Provides a means for a single context menu to declare the placement of their containing group after the containing group of the item with the specified label.

member.name: P:Electron.MenuItemOptions.after(System.String[])
member.summary: Inserts this item after the item with the specified label. If the referenced item doesn't exist the item will be inserted at the end of the menu.

member.name: P:Electron.MenuItemOptions.acceleratorWorksWhenHidden(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
[macOS] Default is `true`, and when `false` will prevent the accelerator from triggering the item if the item is not visible.
This is specified as being macOS-only because accelerators always work when items are hidden on Windows and Linux. The option is exposed to users to give them the option to turn it off, as this is possible in native macOS development. This property is only usable on macOS High Sierra 10.13 or newer.

member.name: P:Electron.LoginItemSettings.restoreState
member.summary: True if the app was opened as a login item that should restore the state from the previous session. This indicates that the app should restore the windows that were open the last time the app was closed. This setting is not available on Mac App Store builds.

member.name: M:Electron.Dock.bounce(Electron.DockBounceType)
member.summary:
Returns an ID representing the request.
[macOS] When DockBounceType.Critical is passed, the dock icon will bounce until either the application becomes active or the request is canceled.
When DockBounceType.Informational is passed, the dock icon will bounce for one second. However, the request remains active until either the application becomes active or the request is canceled.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.uploadToServer(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether crash reports should be sent to the server. If false, crash reports will be collected and stored in the crashes directory, but not uploaded. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.submitURL(System.String)
member.summary: URL that crash reports will be sent to as POST.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.rateLimit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: [macOS, Windows] If true, limit the number of crashes uploaded to 1/hour. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.productName(System.String)
member.summary: Defaults to `app.name`.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.ignoreSystemCrashHandler(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If true, crashes generated in the main process will not be forwarded to the system crash handler. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.globalExtra(System.Object)
member.summary: Extra string key/value annotations that will be sent along with any crash reports generated in any process. These annotations cannot be changed once the crash reporter has been started. If a key is present in both the global extra parameters and the process-specific extra parameters, then the global one will take precedence. By default, `productName` and the app version are included, as well as the Electron version.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.extra(System.Object)
member.summary: Extra string key/value annotations that will be sent along with crash reports that are generated in the main process. Only string values are supported. Crashes generated in child processes will not contain these extra parameters to crash reports generated from child processes, call `addExtraParameter` from the child process.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.compress(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If true, crash reports will be compressed and uploaded with `Content-Encoding: gzip`. Not all collection servers support compressed payloads. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.uploadToServer
member.summary: Whether crash reports should be sent to the server. If false, crash reports will be collected and stored in the crashes directory, but not uploaded. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.submitURL
member.summary: URL that crash reports will be sent to as POST.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.rateLimit
member.summary: [macOS, Windows] If true, limit the number of crashes uploaded to 1/hour. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.productName
member.summary: Defaults to `app.name`.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.ignoreSystemCrashHandler
member.summary: If true, crashes generated in the main process will not be forwarded to the system crash handler. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.globalExtra
member.summary: Extra string key/value annotations that will be sent along with any crash reports generated in any process. These annotations cannot be changed once the crash reporter has been started. If a key is present in both the global extra parameters and the process-specific extra parameters, then the global one will take precedence. By default, `productName` and the app version are included, as well as the Electron version.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.extra
member.summary: Extra string key/value annotations that will be sent along with crash reports that are generated in the main process. Only string values are supported. Crashes generated in child processes will not contain these extra parameters to crash reports generated from child processes, call `addExtraParameter` from the child process.

member.name: P:Electron.CrashReporterStartOptions.compress
member.summary: If true, crash reports will be compressed and uploaded with `Content-Encoding: gzip`. Not all collection servers support compressed payloads. Default is false.

member.summary: Title or alt text of the selection that the context was invoked on.

member.summary: Source URL for the element that the context menu was invoked on. Elements with source URLs are images, audio and video.

member.summary: The flags for the media element the context menu was invoked on.

member.name: P:Electron.ContextMenuParams.linkURL

member.name: P:Electron.ContextMenuParams.editFlags
member.summary: These flags indicate whether the renderer believes it is able to perform the corresponding action.

member.name: P:Electron.ContextMenuParams.dictionarySuggestions
member.summary: An array of suggested words to show the user to replace the `misspelledWord`. Only available if there is a misspelled word and spellchecker is enabled.

member.name: P:Electron.ProxyConfig.proxyRules(System.String)
member.summary:
Rules indicating which proxies to use.
When pacScript and proxyRules are provided together, the proxyRules option is ignored and pacScript configuration is applied.
This property has to follow specific rules, see https://electronjs.org/docs/api/session#sessetproxyconfig

member.name: P:Electron.ProxyConfig.proxyBypassRules(System.String)

This property has to follow specific rules, see https://electronjs.org/docs/api/session#sessetproxyconfig

member.name: P:Electron.ProxyConfig.pacScript(System.String)
member.summary:
The URL associated with the PAC file.
When pacScript and proxyRules are provided together, the proxyRules option is ignored and pacScript configuration is applied.

member.name: M:Electron.CommandLine.hasSwitch(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates whether the command-line switch is present.

member.name: M:Electron.CommandLine.getSwitchValue(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns the command-line switch value.
Note: When the switch is not present or has no value, it returns empty string.

member.name: M:Electron.CommandLine.appendSwitch(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Append a switch (with optional value) to Chromium's command line.
Note: This will not affect process.argv. The intended usage of this function is to control Chromium's behaviors.
member.param: A command-line switch, without the leading --

member.name: M:Electron.CommandLine.appendArgument(System.String)
member.summary:
Append an argument to Chromium's command line. The argument will be quoted correctly.
Switches will precede arguments regardless of appending order. If you're appending an argument like --switch=value, consider using appendSwitch('switch', 'value') instead.
Note: This will not affect process.argv. The intended usage of this function is to control Chromium's behavior.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.zoomToPageWidth(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls the behavior on macOS when option-clicking the green stoplight button on the toolbar or by clicking the Window > Zoom menu item. If true, the window will grow to the preferred width of the web page when zoomed, false will cause it to zoom to the width of the screen. This will also affect the behavior when calling maximize() directly. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.y(System.Int32)
member.summary: Window's top offset from screen. Required if `x` is used. Default is to center the window.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.x(System.Int32)
member.summary: Window's left offset from screen. Required if `y` is used. Default is to center the window.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.width(System.Int32)
member.summary: Window's width in pixels. Default is 800.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.webPreferences(Electron.WebPreferences)
member.summary: Settings of web page's features.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.vibrancy(Electron.VibrancyType)
member.summary: Add a type of vibrancy effect to the window, only on macOS. Please note that using `frame: false` in combination with a vibrancy value requires that you use a non-default `titleBarStyle` as well.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.useContentSize(System.Boolean)
member.summary: The width and height would be used as web page's size, which means the actual window's size will include window frame's size and be slightly larger. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.type(Electron.BrowserWindowStyle)
member.summary: The type of window.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.transparent(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes the window transparent. Default is `false`. On Windows, does not work unless the window is frameless.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.trafficLightPosition(Electron.Point)
member.summary: Set a custom position for the traffic light buttons. Can only be used with `titleBarStyle` set to `TitleBarStyle.Hidden`.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.titleBarStyle(Electron.TitleBarStyle)
member.summary: The style of window title bar. Default is TitleBarStyle.Default.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.title(System.String)
member.summary: Default window title. Default is "Electron". If the HTML tag `<title>` is defined in the HTML file loaded by loadURL(), this property will be ignored.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.thickFrame(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use `WS_THICKFRAME` style for frameless windows on Windows, which adds standard window frame. Setting it to false will remove window shadow and window animations. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.tabbingIdentifier(System.String)
member.summary: Tab group name, allows opening the window as a native tab on macOS 10.12+. Windows with the same tabbing identifier will be grouped together. This also adds a native new tab button to your window's tab bar and allows your app and window to receive the new-window-for-tab event.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.skipTaskbar(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to show the window in taskbar. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.simpleFullscreen(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use pre-Lion fullscreen on macOS. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.show(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether window should be shown when created. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.resizable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether window is resizable. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.parent(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Electron.BrowserWindow})
member.summary: Specify parent window. Default is None.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.paintWhenInitiallyHidden(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether the renderer should be active when `show` is `false` and it has just been created. In order for `document.visibilityState` to work correctly on first load with `show: false` you should set this to `false`. Setting this to `false` will cause the `ready-to-show` event to not fire. Default is `true`.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.opacity(System.Double)
member.summary: Set the initial opacity of the window, between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque). This is only implemented on Windows and macOS.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.movable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether window is movable. This is not implemented on Linux. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.modal(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether this is a modal window. This only works when the window is a child window. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.minimizable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether window is minimizable. This is not implemented on Linux. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.minWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary: Window's minimum width. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.minHeight(System.Int32)
member.summary: Window's minimum height. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.maximizable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether window is maximizable. This is not implemented on Linux. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.maxWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary: Window's maximum width. Default is no limit.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.maxHeight(System.Int32)
member.summary: Window's maximum height. Default is no limit.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.kiosk(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether the window is in kiosk mode. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.icon(Fable.Core.U2{Electron.NativeImage,System.String})
member.summary: The window icon. On Windows it is recommended to use ICO icons to get best visual effects, you can also leave it undefined so the executable's icon will be used.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.height(System.Int32)
member.summary: Window's height in pixels. Default is 600.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.hasShadow(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether window should have a shadow. This is only implemented on macOS. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.fullscreenable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether the window can be put into fullscreen mode. On macOS, also whether the maximize/zoom button should toggle full screen mode or maximize window. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.fullscreenWindowTitle(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Shows the title in the title bar in full screen mode on macOS for all titleBarStyle options. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.fullscreen(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether the window should show in fullscreen. When explicitly set to false the fullscreen button will be hidden or disabled on macOS. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.frame(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specify false to create a frameless window. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.focusable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether the window can be focused. Default is true. On Windows setting focusable: false also implies setting skipTaskbar: true. On Linux setting focusable: false makes the window stop interacting with wm, so the window will always stay on top in all workspaces.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.enableLargerThanScreen(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable the window to be resized larger than screen. Only relevant for macOS, as other OSes allow larger-than-screen windows by default. Default is `false`.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.disableAutoHideCursor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether to hide cursor when typing. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.darkTheme(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Forces using dark theme for the window, only works on some GTK+3 desktop environments. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.closable(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether window is closable. This is not implemented on Linux. Default is true.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.center(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Show window in the center of the screen.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.backgroundColor(System.String)
member.summary: Window's background color as a hexadecimal value, like #66CD00 or #FFF or #80FFFFFF (alpha in #AARRGGBB format is supported if transparent is set to true). Default is #FFF (white).

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.autoHideMenuBar(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Auto hide the menu bar unless the Alt key is pressed. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.alwaysOnTop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether the window should always stay on top of other windows. Default is false.

member.name: P:Electron.BrowserWindowOptions.acceptFirstMouse(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Whether the web view accepts a single mouse-down event that simultaneously activates the window. Default is false.

member.name: T:Electron.BrowserWindowStyle.Desktop
member.summary: [Linux, macOS] On macOS, places the window at the desktop background window level (kCGDesktopWindowLevel - 1). Note that desktop window will not receive focus, keyboard or mouse events, but you can use globalShortcut to receive input sparingly.

member.name: T:Electron.TitleBarStyle.CustomButtonsOnHover
member.summary: Draw custom close, and minimize buttons on macOS frameless windows. These buttons will not display unless hovered over in the top left of the window. These custom buttons prevent issues with mouse events that occur with the standard window toolbar buttons. Note: This option is currently experimental.

member.name: T:Electron.TitleBarStyle.HiddenInset
member.summary: Results in a hidden title bar with an alternative look where the traffic light buttons are slightly more inset from the window edge.

member.name: T:Electron.TitleBarStyle.Hidden
member.summary: Results in a hidden title bar and a full size content window, yet the title bar still has the standard window controls ("traffic lights") in the top left.

member.name: T:Electron.TitleBarStyle.Default
member.summary: Results in the standard gray opaque Mac title bar.

The callback has to be called with an OnHeadersReceivedResponse object.

member.name: M:Electron.WebFrame.setZoomLevel(System.Double)
member.summary: Changes the zoom level to the specified level. The original size is 0 and each increment above or below represents zooming 20% larger or smaller to default limits of 300% and 50% of original size, respectively.

member.name: M:Electron.WebFrame.setZoomFactor(System.Double)
member.summary: Changes the zoom factor to the specified factor. Zoom factor is zoom percent divided by 100, so 300% = 3.0. The factor must be greater than 0.0. Default is 1.0.

member.summary:
Sets the maximum and minimum pinch-to-zoom level.
Note: Visual zoom is disabled by default in Electron. To re-enable it, call: webFrame.setVisualZoomLevelLimits(1, 3)

member.name: M:Electron.WebFrame.setSpellCheckProvider(System.String,Electron.SpellCheckProvider)
member.summary: Sets a provider for spell checking in input fields and text areas. The provider must be an object that has a spellCheck method that accepts an array of individual words for spellchecking. The spellCheck function runs asynchronously and calls the callback function with an array of misspelt words when complete. An example of using node-spellchecker as provider:

member.name: P:Electron.WebFrame.top
member.summary: A WebFrame representing top frame in frame hierarchy to which webFrame belongs, the property would be None if top frame is not in the current renderer process.

member.name: P:Electron.WebFrame.routingId
member.summary: The unique frame id in the current renderer process. Distinct WebFrame instances that refer to the same underlying frame will have the same routingId.

member.name: P:Electron.WebFrame.parent
member.summary: A WebFrame representing parent frame of webFrame, the property would be None if webFrame is top or parent is not in the current renderer process.

member.name: P:Electron.WebFrame.opener
member.summary: A WebFrame representing the frame which opened webFrame, the property would be None if there's no opener or opener is not in the current renderer process.

member.name: P:Electron.WebFrame.nextSibling
member.summary: A WebFrame representing next sibling frame, the property would be None if webFrame is the last frame in its parent or if the next sibling is not in the current renderer process.

member.name: P:Electron.WebFrame.firstChild
member.summary: A WebFrame representing the first child frame of webFrame, the property would be None if webFrame has no children or if first child is not in the current renderer process.

member.summary: Returns a child of webFrame with the supplied name, None would be returned if there's no such frame or if the frame is not in the current renderer process.

Work like executeJavaScript but evaluates scripts in an isolated context.
Returns a promise that resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if execution throws or results in a rejected promise.
In the browser window some HTML APIs like requestFullScreen can only be invoked by a gesture from the user. Setting userGesture to true will remove this limitation.
member.param: The ID of the world to run the javascript in, 0 is the default world, 999 is the world used by Electrons contextIsolation feature. Chrome extensions reserve the range of IDs in `[1 << 20, 1 << 29)`. You can provide any integer here.
Default is false

Called after script has been executed. Unless the frame is suspended (e.g. showing a modal alert), execution will be synchronous and the callback will be invoked before the method returns. Parameters: result, error

member.name: M:Electron.WebFrame.executeJavaScript(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Boolean},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Object},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Node.Base.Error,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}})
member.summary:
Evaluates `code` in page.
Returns a promise that resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if execution throws or results in a rejected promise.
In the browser window some HTML APIs like requestFullScreen can only be invoked by a gesture from the user. Setting userGesture to true will remove this limitation.
The callback is called after script has been executed. Unless the frame is suspended (e.g. showing a modal alert), execution will be synchronous and the callback will be invoked before the method returns. Parameters: result, error

member.name: M:Electron.WebFrame.clearCache
member.summary:
Attempts to free memory that is no longer being used (like images from a previous navigation).
Note that blindly calling this method probably makes Electron slower since it will have to refill these emptied caches, you should only call it if an event in your app has occurred that makes you think your page is actually using less memory (i.e. you have navigated from a super heavy page to a mostly empty one, and intend to stay there).

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.setIgnoreMenuShortcuts(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Ignore application menu shortcuts while this web contents is focused.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.setFrameRate(System.Int32)
member.summary: If offscreen rendering is enabled sets the frame rate to the specified number. Only values between 1 and 60 are accepted.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.setDevToolsWebContents(Electron.WebContents)
member.summary:
Uses the devToolsWebContents as the target WebContents to show devtools.
The devToolsWebContents must not have done any navigation, and it should not be used for other purposes after the call.
By default Electron manages the devtools by creating an internal WebContents with native view, which developers have very limited control of. With the setDevToolsWebContents method, developers can use any WebContents to show the devtools in it, including BrowserWindow and BrowserView.
Note that closing the devtools does not destroy the devToolsWebContents, it is caller's responsibility to destroy devToolsWebContents.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.setBackgroundThrottling(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Controls whether or not this WebContents will throttle animations and timers when the page becomes backgrounded. This also affects the Page Visibility API.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.setAudioMuted(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Mute the audio on the current web page.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.sendToFrame(System.Int32,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Send an asynchronous message to a specific frame in a renderer process via `channel`, along with arguments. Arguments will be serialized with the [Structured Clone Algorithm](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_Workers_API/Structured_clone_algorithm), just like [`postMessage`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/postMessage), so prototype chains will not be included. Sending Functions, Promises, Symbols, WeakMaps, or WeakSets will throw an exception.
> **NOTE**: Sending non-standard JavaScript types such as DOM objects or special Electron objects is deprecated, and will begin throwing an exception starting with Electron 9.
The renderer process can handle the message by listening to `channel` with the [`ipcRenderer`](https://www.electronjs.org/docs/api/ipc-renderer) module.
If you want to get the `frameId` of a given renderer context you should use the `webFrame.routingId` value.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.sendInputEvent(Electron.SendInputEvent)
member.summary:
Sends an input event to the page. `event` may be a instance of SendKeyboardEvent, SendMouseEvent, or SendMouseWheelEvent.
Note: The BrowserWindow containing the contents needs to be focused for `sendInputEvent()` to work.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.send(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary:
Send an asynchronous message to the main process via `channel`, along with arguments. Arguments will be serialized with the [Structured Clone Algorithm](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Web_Workers_API/Structured_clone_algorithm), just like [`postMessage`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/postMessage), so prototype chains will not be included. Sending Functions, Promises, Symbols, WeakMaps, or WeakSets will throw an exception.
**NOTE**: Sending non-standard JavaScript types such as DOM objects or special Electron objects is deprecated, and will begin throwing an exception starting with Electron 9.
The main process handles it by listening for `channel` with the [`ipcMain`](https://www.electronjs.org/docs/api/ipc-main) module.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.removeInsertedCSS(System.String)
member.summary:
Removes the inserted CSS from the current web page. The stylesheet is identified by its key, which is returned from `contents.insertCSS(css)`.
The promise resolves if the removal was successful.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.printToPDF(Electron.PrintToPDFOptions)
member.summary:
Prints window's web page as PDF with Chromium's preview printing custom settings.
Returns a promise that resolves with the generated PDF data.
The landscape will be ignored if `@page` CSS at-rule is used in the web page.
Use `page-break-before: always;` CSS style to force to print to a new page.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.print(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Electron.PrintOptions},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.Boolean,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Electron.PrintFailureReason},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}})
member.summary:
Prints window's web page. The callback indicates whether the print call was successful.
When `silent` is set to true, Electron will pick the system's default printer if `deviceName` is empty and the default settings for printing.
Use `page-break-before: always;` CSS style to force to print to a new page.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onZoomChanged(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.ZoomChangedDirection,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary: Emitted when the user is requesting to change the zoom level using the mouse wheel.

Emitted as a server side redirect occurs during navigation. For example a 302 redirect.
This event will be emitted after did-start-navigation and always before the did-redirect-navigation event for the same navigation.
Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the navigation (not just the redirect).
Parameters:
- event - url - isInPlace - isMainFrame - frameProcessId - frameRoutingId

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onWillPreventUnload(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary:
Emitted when a beforeunload event handler is attempting to cancel a page unload.
Calling event.preventDefault() will ignore the beforeunload event handler and allow the page to be unloaded.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onWillNavigate(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary:
Emitted when a user or the page wants to start navigation. It can happen when the window.location object is changed or a user clicks a link in the page. The listener receives the URL.
This event will not emit when the navigation is started programmatically with APIs like webContents.loadURL and webContents.back.
It is also not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the window.location.hash. Use did-navigate-in-page event for this purpose.
Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the navigation.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onUpdateTargetUrl(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary: Emitted when mouse moves over a link or the keyboard moves the focus to a link. The listener receives the url.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onUnresponsive(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary: Emitted when the web page becomes unresponsive.

Emitted when a client certificate is requested.
The usage is the same with the `select-client-certificate` event of `app`.
Parameters:
- event - url - certificateList - callback: call with a certificate from the given list to select it

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onSelectBluetoothDevice(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.BluetoothDevice[],Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}})
member.summary: Emitted when bluetooth device needs to be selected on call to navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice. To use navigator.bluetooth api webBluetooth should be enabled. If event.preventDefault is not called, first available device will be selected. callback should be called with deviceId to be selected, passing empty string to callback will cancel the request.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onResponsive(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary: Emitted when the unresponsive web page becomes responsive again.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onRemoteRequire(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.IpcMainEvent,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary: Emitted when remote.require() is called in the renderer process. The listener is passed the module name. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the module from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting event.returnValue.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onRemoteGetGlobal(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.IpcMainEvent,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary: Emitted when remote.getGlobal() is called in the renderer process. The listener is passed the global name. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the global from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting event.returnValue.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onRemoteGetCurrentWindow(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.IpcMainEvent,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary: Emitted when remote.getCurrentWindow() is called in the renderer process. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the object from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting event.returnValue.

member.summary: Emitted when remote.getCurrentWebContents() is called in the renderer process. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the object from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting event.returnValue.

member.summary: Emitted when remote.getBuiltin() is called in the renderer process. The listener is passed the module name. Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent the module from being returned. Custom value can be returned by setting event.returnValue.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onPluginCrashed(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}})

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onPaint(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.Rectangle,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.NativeImage,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}})

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onPageTitleUpdated(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.Boolean,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}})
member.summary:
Fired when page title is set during navigation. explicitSet is false when title is synthesized from file url.

- event - title - explicitSet

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onPageFaviconUpdated(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String[],Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary: Emitted when page receives favicon urls. Called with the URLs.

Emitted when the page requests to open a new window for a url. It could be requested by window.open or an external link like <a target='_blank'>.
By default a new BrowserWindow will be created for the url.
Calling event.preventDefault() will prevent Electron from automatically creating a new BrowserWindow. If you call event.preventDefault() and manually create a new BrowserWindow then you must set event.newGuest to reference the new BrowserWindow instance, failing to do so may result in unexpected behavior.
Parameters:
- event - url - frameName - disposition - options: The options which will be used for creating the new BrowserWindow - additionalFeatures: The non-standard features (features not handled by Chromium or Electron) given to window.open() - referrer: The referrer that will be passed to the new window. May or may not result in the Referer header being sent, depending on the referrer policy.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onMediaStartedPlaying(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary: Emitted when media starts playing.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onMediaPaused(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary: Emitted when media is paused or done playing.

Emitted when webContents wants to do basic auth.
The usage is the same with the `login` event of `app`.
Parameters:
- event
- request - authInfo - callback(username, password)

member.summary: Emitted when the window enters a full-screen state triggered by HTML API.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onDomReady(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary: Emitted when the document in the given frame is loaded.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onDidStopLoading(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab stopped spinning.

Emitted when any frame (including main) starts navigating. isInplace will be true for in-page navigations.
Parameters:
- event - url - isInPlace - isMainFrame - frameProcessId - frameRoutingId

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onDidStartLoading(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary: Corresponds to the points in time when the spinner of the tab started spinning.

Emitted after a server side redirect occurs during navigation. For example a 302 redirect.
This event can not be prevented, if you want to prevent redirects you should checkout out the `will-redirect` event.
Parameters:
- event - url - isInPlace - isMainFrame - frameProcessId - frameRoutingId

Emitted when an in-page navigation happened in any frame.
When in-page navigation happens, the page URL changes but does not cause navigation outside of the page. Examples of this occurring are when anchor links are clicked or when the DOM `hashchange` event is triggered.
Parameters:
- event - url - isMainFrame - frameProcessId - frameRoutingId

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onDidNavigate(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.Int32,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}}})
member.summary:
Emitted when a main frame navigation is done.
This event is not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the window.location.hash. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.
Parameters:
- event - url - httpResponseCode: -1 for non HTTP navigations - httpStatusText: empty for non HTTP navigations

Emitted when any frame navigation is done.
This event is not emitted for in-page navigations, such as clicking anchor links or updating the window.location.hash. Use `did-navigate-in-page` event for this purpose.
Parameters:
- event - url - httpResponseCode: -1 for non HTTP navigations - httpStatusText: empty for non HTTP navigations - isMainFrame - frameProcessId - frameRoutingId

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onDidFrameFinishLoad(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.Boolean,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.Int32,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.Int32,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}}})
member.summary:
Emitted when a frame has done navigation.
Parameters:
- event - isMainFrame - frameProcessId - frameRoutingId

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onDidFinishLoad(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary: Emitted when the navigation is done, i.e. the spinner of the tab has stopped spinning, and the `onload` event was dispatched.

This event is like `did-fail-load` but emitted when the load was cancelled (e.g. `window.stop()` was invoked).
Parameters:
- event - errorCode - errorDescription - validatedURL - isMainFrame - frameProcessId - frameRoutingId

This event is like did-finish-load but emitted when the load failed. The full list of error codes and their meaning is available [here](https://cs.chromium.org/chromium/src/net/base/net_error_list.h).
Parameters:
- event - errorCode - errorDescription - validatedURL - isMainFrame - frameProcessId - frameRoutingId

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onDidChangeThemeColor(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.String},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary:
Emitted when a page's theme color changes. This is usually due to encountering a meta tag.
The listener gets the theme color in format "#rrggbb". It is None when no theme color is set.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onDesktopCapturerGetSources(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit})
member.summary: Emitted when desktopCapturer.getSources() is called in the renderer process. Calling event.preventDefault() will make it return empty sources.

Emitted when the cursor's type changes. If the type is CursorType.Custom, the `image` parameter will hold the custom cursor image, and `scale`, `size` and `hotspot` will hold additional information about the custom cursor.
Parameters:
- event
- type - image - scale: scaling factor for the custom cursor - size: the size of the image - hotspot: coordinates of the custom cursor's hotspot

member.summary: Emitted when the renderer process crashes or is killed. Called with true if killed, false if crashed.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onContextMenu(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.ContextMenuParams,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary: Emitted when there is a new context menu that needs to be handled.

Emitted when the associated window logs a console message.
Parameters:
- event - level - message - line - sourceId

Emitted when failed to verify the certificate for `url`.
The usage is the same with the `certificate-error` event of `app`.
Parameters:
- event - url - error - certificate - callback: call with true if the certificate can be trusted.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.onBeforeInputEvent(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Browser.Types.Event,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.BeforeInputEventData,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary:
Emitted before dispatching the keydown and keyup events in the page. Calling event.preventDefault will prevent the page keydown/keyup events and the menu shortcuts.
To only prevent the menu shortcuts, use setIgnoreMenuShortcuts.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.loadURL(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Electron.LoadURLOptions})
member.summary:
Loads the url in the window. The url must contain the protocol prefix, e.g. the http:// or file://. If the load should bypass http cache then use the pragma header to achieve it.
The promise will resolve when the page has finished loading (see `did-finish-load`), and rejects if the page fails to load (see `did-fail-load`). A noop rejection handler is already attached, which avoids unhandled rejection errors.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.loadFile(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Electron.LoadFileOptions})
member.summary: Loads the given file in the window, filePath should be a path to an HTML file relative to the root of your application.

member.summary: Injects CSS into the current web page and returns a unique key for the inserted stylesheet that can later be used to remove the CSS via `contents.removeInsertedCSS(key)`.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.incrementCapturerCount(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Electron.Size},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
Increase the capturer count by one. The page is considered visible when its browser window is hidden and the capturer count is non-zero. If you would like the page to stay hidden, you should ensure that `stayHidden` is set to true.
This also affects the Page Visibility API.
member.param: The perferred size for the capturer.
Keep the page hidden instead of visible.

member.summary: Navigates to the specified offset from the "current entry".

member.summary: Navigates browser to the specified absolute web page index.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.goForward
member.summary: Makes the browser go forward a web page.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.goBack
member.summary: Makes the browser go back a web page.

member.name: P:Electron.WebContents.zoomLevel
member.summary:
Determines the zoom level for this web contents.
The original size is 0 and each increment above or below represents zooming 20% larger or smaller to default limits of 300% and 50% of original size, respectively. The formula for this is `scale := 1.2 ^ level`.

member.name: P:Electron.WebContents.zoomFactor
member.summary:
Determines the zoom factor for this web contents.
The zoom factor is the zoom percent divided by 100, so 300% = 3.0.

member.name: P:Electron.WebContents.userAgent
member.summary: Determines the user agent for this web page.

member.name: P:Electron.WebContents.session
member.summary: A Session used by this webContents.

member.name: P:Electron.WebContents.id
member.summary: The unique ID of this WebContents. Each ID is unique among all WebContents instances of the entire Electron application.

member.name: P:Electron.WebContents.hostWebContents
member.summary: A WebContents instance that might own this WebContents.

member.name: P:Electron.WebContents.frameRate
member.summary: Sets the frame rate of the web contents to the specified number. Only values between 1 and 60 are accepted.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.findInPage(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Electron.FindInPageOptions})
member.summary: Starts a request to find all matches for the text in the web page. The result of the request can be obtained by subscribing to `found-in-page` event. Returns the request id used for the request.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.executeJavaScriptInIsolatedWorld(System.Int32,Electron.WebSource[],Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
Works like executeJavaScript but evaluates scripts in an isolated context.
The returned promise resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if the result of the code is a rejected promise.
member.param: The ID of the world to run the javascript in, 0 is the default world, 999 is the world used by Electrons contextIsolation feature. Chrome extensions reserve the range of IDs in `[1 << 20, 1 << 29)`. You can provide any integer here.
Default is false

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.executeJavaScript(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
Evaluates `code` in page.
The returned promise resolves with the result of the executed code or is rejected if the result of the code is a rejected promise.
In the browser window some HTML APIs like `requestFullScreen` can only be invoked by a gesture from the user. Setting `userGesture` to `true` will remove this limitation.
Code execution will be suspended until web page stop loading.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.beginFrameSubscription(System.Boolean,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.NativeImage,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.Rectangle,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary:
Begin subscribing for presentation events and captured frames, the callback will be called with callback(image, dirtyRect) when there is a presentation event.
The `image` is an instance of NativeImage that stores the captured frame.
The `dirtyRect` describes which part of the page was repainted. If onlyDirty is set to true, image will only contain the repainted area.

member.name: M:Electron.WebContents.beginFrameSubscription(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.NativeImage,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Electron.Rectangle,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}})
member.summary:
Begin subscribing for presentation events and captured frames, the callback will be called with callback(image, dirtyRect) when there is a presentation event.
The `image` is an instance of NativeImage that stores the captured frame.
The `dirtyRect` describes which part of the page was repainted.

member.name: T:Electron.WebRtcIpHandlingPolicy.DisableNonProxiedUdp
member.summary: Does not expose public or local IPs. When this policy is used, WebRTC should only use TCP to contact peers or servers unless the proxy server supports UDP.

member.name: T:Electron.WebRtcIpHandlingPolicy.DefaultPublicAndPrivateInterfaces
member.summary: Exposes user's public and local IPs. When this policy is used, WebRTC should only use the default route used by http. This also exposes the associated default private address. Default route is the route chosen by the OS on a multi-homed endpoint.

member.name: T:Electron.WebRtcIpHandlingPolicy.DefaultPublicInterfaceOnly
member.summary: Exposes user's public IP, but does not expose user's local IP. When this policy is used, WebRTC should only use the default route used by http. This doesn't expose any local addresses.

member.name: T:Electron.WebRtcIpHandlingPolicy.Default
member.summary: Exposes user's public and local IPs. This is the default behavior. When this policy is used, WebRTC has the right to enumerate all interfaces and bind them to discover public interfaces.

member.name: M:Electron.TrayStatic.Create(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Guid})
member.summary:
Creates a new tray icon associated with the image.
Specifying `guid` assigns a GUID to the tray icon. If the executable is signed and the signature contains an organization in the subject line then the GUID is permanently associated with that signature. OS level settings like the position of the tray icon in the system tray will persist even if the path to the executable changes. If the executable is not code-signed then the GUID is permanently associated with the path to the executable. Changing the path to the executable will break the creation of the tray icon and a new GUID must be used. However, it is highly recommended to use the GUID parameter only in conjunction with code-signed executable. If an App defines multiple tray icons then each icon must use a separate GUID.

member.name: M:Electron.TrayStatic.Create(Electron.NativeImage,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Guid})
member.summary:
Creates a new tray icon associated with the image.
Specifying `guid` assigns a GUID to the tray icon. If the executable is signed and the signature contains an organization in the subject line then the GUID is permanently associated with that signature. OS level settings like the position of the tray icon in the system tray will persist even if the path to the executable changes. If the executable is not code-signed then the GUID is permanently associated with the path to the executable. Changing the path to the executable will break the creation of the tray icon and a new GUID must be used. However, it is highly recommended to use the GUID parameter only in conjunction with code-signed executable. If an App defines multiple tray icons then each icon must use a separate GUID.

member.name: P:Electron.TraceConfig.histogram_names

member.name: P:Electron.TraceConfig.enable_argument_filter
member.summary: If `true`, filter event data according to a whitelist of events that have been manually vetted to not include any PII. See the [implementation in Chromium](https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/services/tracing/public/cpp/trace_event_args_whitelist.cc) for specifics.

member.name: P:Electron.TraceCategoriesAndOptions.traceOptions(System.String)
member.summary: Controls what kind of tracing is enabled, it is a comma-delimited sequence of the following strings: `record-until-full`, `record-continuously`, `trace-to-console`, `enable-sampling`, `enable-systrace`. Example: "record-until-full,enable-sampling". The first 3 options are trace recording modes and hence mutually exclusive. If more than one trace recording modes appear in the traceOptions string, the last one takes precedence. If none of the trace recording modes are specified, recording mode is `record-until-full`. The trace option will first be reset to the default option (record_mode set to record-until-full, enable_sampling and enable_systrace set to false) before options parsed from traceOptions are applied on it.

member.name: P:Electron.TraceCategoriesAndOptions.categoryFilter(System.String)
member.summary: A filter to control what category groups should be traced. A filter can have an optional `-` prefix to exclude category groups that contain a matching category. Having both included and excluded category patterns in the same list is not supported. Examples: `test_MyTest*`, `test_MyTest*,test_OtherStuff`, `-excluded_category1,-excluded_category2`.

member.name: P:Electron.TraceCategoriesAndOptions.traceOptions
member.summary: Controls what kind of tracing is enabled, it is a comma-delimited sequence of the following strings: `record-until-full`, `record-continuously`, `trace-to-console`, `enable-sampling`, `enable-systrace`. Example: "record-until-full,enable-sampling". The first 3 options are trace recording modes and hence mutually exclusive. If more than one trace recording modes appear in the traceOptions string, the last one takes precedence. If none of the trace recording modes are specified, recording mode is `record-until-full`. The trace option will first be reset to the default option (record_mode set to record-until-full, enable_sampling and enable_systrace set to false) before options parsed from traceOptions are applied on it.

member.name: M:Electron.TouchBarStatic.Create(Electron.TouchBarOptions)
member.summary:
Creates a new touch bar with the specified items. Use BrowserWindow.setTouchBar to add the TouchBar to a window.
Note: The TouchBar API is currently experimental and may change or be removed in future Electron releases.
Tip: If you don't have a MacBook with Touch Bar, you can use Touch Bar Simulator to test Touch Bar usage in your app.

member.summary: [macOS] Same as unsubscribeNotification, but removes the subscriber from NSWorkspace.sharedWorkspace.notificationCenter.

member.summary: [macOS] Removes the subscriber with `id`.

member.summary: [macOS] Same as unsubscribeNotification, but removes the subscriber from NSNotificationCenter.

member.name: M:Electron.SystemPreferences.subscribeWorkspaceNotification(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Object},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}})
member.summary: [macOS] Same as subscribeNotification, but uses NSWorkspace.sharedWorkspace.notificationCenter. This is necessary for events such as NSWorkspaceDidActivateApplicationNotification.

member.name: M:Electron.SystemPreferences.subscribeNotification(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Object},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}})
member.summary:
[macOS] Subscribes to native notifications of macOS, callback will be called with callback(event, userInfo) when the corresponding event happens. The `userInfo` is an object that contains the user information dictionary sent along with the notification. The `object` is the sender of the notification, and only supports `NSString` values for now.
The id of the subscriber is returned, which can be used to unsubscribe the event. Under the hood this API subscribes to NSDistributedNotificationCenter.

member.name: M:Electron.SystemPreferences.subscribeLocalNotification(System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{System.Object},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.String,Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit}}})
member.summary: [macOS] Same as subscribeNotification, but uses NSNotificationCenter for local defaults. This is necessary for events such as NSUserDefaultsDidChangeNotification.

member.name: P:Electron.SystemPreferences.effectiveAppearance(Electron.Appearance)
member.summary:
[macOS] Returns the macOS appearance setting that is currently applied to your application, maps to NSApplication.effectiveAppearance
Please note that until Electron is built targeting the 10.14 SDK, your application's `effectiveAppearance` will default to `Appearance.Light` and won't inherit the OS preference. In the interim in order for your application to inherit the OS preference you must set the `NSRequiresAquaSystemAppearance` key in your apps `Info.plist` to `false`. If you are using `electron-packager` or `electron-forge` just set the `enableDarwinDarkMode` packager option to `true`. See the Electron Packager API for more details.

member.name: P:Electron.SystemPreferences.appLevelAppearance(Electron.Appearance)
member.summary:
[macOS] Determines the macOS appearance setting for your application. This maps to values in NSApplication.appearance. Setting this will override the system default as well as the value of `getEffectiveAppearance`.
Possible values that can be set are Appearance.Dark and Appearance.Light, and possible return values are Appearance.Dark, AppLevelAppearance.Light, and Appearance.Unknown.
This property is only available on macOS 10.14 Mojave or newer.

member.name: M:Electron.SystemPreferences.promptTouchID(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a promise that resolves if the user has successfully authenticated with Touch ID.
This API itself will not protect your user data; rather, it is a mechanism to allow you to do so. Native apps will need to set Access Control Constants like `kSecAccessControlUserPresence` on the their keychain entry so that reading it would auto-prompt for Touch ID biometric consent. This could be done with [`node-keytar`](https://github.com/atom/node-keytar), such that one would store an encryption key with `node-keytar` and only fetch it if `promptTouchID()` resolves.
Note: This API will return a rejected Promise on macOS systems older than Sierra 10.12.2.
member.param: The reason you are asking for Touch ID authentication
